SINDyBaseÂ¶

Base Module for SINDy: ‘fit’ method must be implemented in inherited classes

class pySINDy.sindybase.SINDyBase(name='SINDy model')

Bases: object

Sparse Identification of Nonlinear Dynamics base class

coefficients
Returns:get the coefficients of the model
descriptions
Returns:get the items we need to fit the data
static exponent_to_description(exponents, typ='sup', remove_zero_order=False, as_dict=False, var_names=None)
Parameters:
  • exponents – a 2D numpy array of exponents
  • typ – a string, can be either ‘sup’ (superscript) or ‘sub’ (subscript)
  • remove_zero_order – boolean value, indicate whether to remove the zero order term
  • as_dict – whether to include exponents in the descriptions as a dict
  • var_names – variable name, default to be None
Returns:

a list or a dict (depends on ‘as_dict’) of descriptions of corresponding exponents
static finite_difference(data, dx, order=1, dim=0)

Take derivative using 2nd order finite difference method :param data: a tensor to be differentiated :param dx: grid spacing, assume to be uniform :param order: the order of the derivative to be applied :param dim: the dimension to be taken the derivative :return: a tensor after differentiation

fit(data)

Abstract method to fit the snapshot matrix, it has to be implemented in subclasses :param data: the snapshot matrix :return: None

static get_ordered_poly_exponents(nfeat, degree=1, remove_zero_order=False)
Parameters:
  • nfeat – number of original features
  • degree – maximum degree of the polynomials
  • remove_zero_order – boolean value, indicate whether to remove the zero order term
Returns:

a 2D array consists of ordered exponents according to the sum
static get_poly_exponents(nfeat, degree=1)
Parameters:
  • nfeat – number of original features
  • degree – maximum degree of the polynomials
Returns:

a 2D array consists of the exponents
static pointwise_polynomial_difference(data, xgrid, order=1, degree=2, index=None)
Parameters:
  • data – a 1D flattened vector represents nearby function values
  • xgrid – grid information
  • order – the order of the derivatives to be applied
  • index – index of the derivative to take
  • degree – degree of polynomial to use
Returns:

value of derivative at this point
static polynomial_difference(data, xgrid, order=1, dim=0, degree=2)

Taking derivatives using Chebyshev polynomial interpolation :param data: a tensor to be differentiated :param xgrid: grid information :param order: an integer, or a list of orders of the derivative to be applied :param dim: the dimension to be taken the derivative :param degree: degree of polynomials to be used for interpolation :return: a list of tensors after differentiation, same length of order

static polynomial_expansion(data, degree=1, remove_zero_order=False, var_names=None)
Parameters:
  • data – a 2D numpy array of original features stored in each column
  • degree – degree of polynomials of features to be expanded
  • remove_zero_order – boolean value, indicate whether to remove the zero order term
  • var_names – variable names, default as None
Returns:

a tensor consists of extended features, and corresponding descriptions
static sparsify_dynamics(mtx, b, init_tol, max_iter=25, thresh_iter=10, l0_penalty=None, split=0.8, normalize=0)
Parameters:
  • mtx – the theta matrix of shape (M, N)
  • b – a vector or an array of shape (M,) or (M, K)
  • init_tol – maximum tolerance (cut_off value)
  • max_iter – maximum iteration of the outer loop
  • thresh_iter – maximum iteration for threshold least squares
  • l0_penalty – penalty factor for nonzero coefficients
  • split – proportion of the training set
  • normalize – normalization methods, default as 0 (no normalization)
Returns:

the best coefficients of fit
static threshold_ls(mtx, b, cut_off=0.001, max_iter=10, normalize=0)

Find the sparse coefficients of fit using threshold least squares :param mtx: the training theta matrix of shape (M, N) :param b: a vector or an array of shape (M,) or (M, K) :param cut_off: the threshold cutoff value :param max_iter: # of iterations :param normalize: normalization methods, default as 0 (no normalization) :return: coefficients of fit
